config.script:
selectedColumn = self.props.selection.selectedColumn
	selectedRow = self.props.selection.selectedRow
	congregationID = event.value['CID']#self.props.data.getValueAt(selectedRow,'CID')
	locationID = event.value['LID']#self.props.data.getValueAt(selectedRow,'LID')
	seasonID = self.props.data.getValueAt(selectedRow,'SID')
	locationName = self.props.data.getValueAt(selectedRow,'locationName')
	thisSeason = self.props.data.getValueAt(selectedRow,'actual')
	#nextSeason = self.props.data.getValueAt(selectedRow,'nextYear')
	#system.perspective.print(str(congregationID))
	if selectedColumn == "locationName": 
		backID = "Congregations"
		page = '/WinterShelter/Congregations/Detail/' + str(locationID) +  '/' + str(backID)
		system.perspective.navigate(page)
		#system.perspective.print(page)
		messageType = 'resetWinterRegistration'
		system.perspective.sendMessage(messageType,scope="view")
	elif selectedColumn == "options":
		#Display the popout preview
		#congregationID = self.props.data.getValueAt(selectedRow,'CID')
		id = "PreviewCongregation" 
		params = {"locationId":locationID}
		if self.custom.DockID != locationID:
			system.perspective.openDock(id=id,params=params)
			payload = {"locationId":locationID}
			system.perspective.sendMessage("DockUpdate", payload=payload, scope = 'view' )
		else:
			system.perspective.toggleDock(id=id,params=params)
		self.custom.DockID = locationID

messageHandlers.script:
'''
	return
	
	from datetime import datetime, date
	
	if(payload['key'] == 'gender'):
		curFilter = str(self.view.params.gender)
		#If checkbox is checked, we're adding the payload
		if(payload['state']):
			#If not default, need to do on-purpose SQL injection
			if(curFilter != '%'):
				self.view.params.gender = curFilter + "%' OR [humans].[Human].[gender] LIKE '" + str(payload['val']) 
			#Else, it's default, just set the value
			else:
				self.view.params.gender = str(payload['val'])
		#If checkbox isn't checked, we're removing the payload
		else:
			#If we already have a SQL injection, we need to remove the selected query
			if('LIKE' in curFilter):
				self.view.params.gender = curFilter.replace("%' OR [humans].[Human].[gender] LIKE '" + str(payload['val']), '')
			#If no SQL injection, set to default
			else:
				self.view.params.gender = '%'
	elif(payload['key'] == 'dobRange'):
		curStartDate = str(self.view.params.startDOB)
		curEndDate = str(self.view.params.endDOB)
		
		today = datetime.now()
		#If 55+ is selected, force it to 55-120
		ageRange = payload['val'].replace('+','-120')
		dashPtr = str(ageRange).find('-')
		
		startAge = int(ageRange[0:dashPtr])
		endAge = int(ageRange[dashPtr + 1:])
		#Start date is now minus end age. End date is now minus start age
		#I would like to confess I spent 3 entire minutes remembering how dates worked on this part
		newStartDOB = today.replace(year = datetime.now().year - endAge)
		newEndDOB = today.replace(year = datetime.now().year - startAge)
		
		#If checkbox is checked, we're adding the payload
		if(payload['state']):
			#If not default, need to do on-purpose SQL injection
			#Note, added if not self check because saw weird instance where this happened from clicking too fast
			if(curEndDate != "2110-01-01" and  curEndDate != newEndDOB.strftime("%Y-%m-%d")):
				newEndQueryStr = curEndDate + "' OR [humans].[Human].[dob] BETWEEN '" + newStartDOB.strftime("%Y-%m-%d") + "' AND '" + newEndDOB.strftime("%Y-%m-%d")
				self.view.params.startDOB = curStartDate
				self.view.params.endDOB = newEndQueryStr
			#Else, it's default, just add the range
			else:
				self.view.params.startDOB = newStartDOB.strftime("%Y-%m-%d")
				self.view.params.endDOB = newEndDOB.strftime("%Y-%m-%d")
		#If checkbox isn't checked, we're removing the payload
		else:
			#If we already have a SQL injection, we need to remove the selected query
			if('OR [humans]' in curEndDate):
				self.view.params.endDOB = curEndDate.replace("' OR [humans].[Human].[dob] BETWEEN '" + newStartDOB.strftime("%Y-%m-%d") + "' AND '" + newEndDOB.strftime("%Y-%m-%d"), '')
			#If no SQL injection, set to default
			else:
				self.view.params.startDOB = '1910-01-01'
				self.view.params.endDOB = '2110-01-01'
	#Have to refresh the binding for the query to run again with the new query strings in the view params
	self.refreshBinding("props.data")
	
	'''

#Commented Out unitl Filters are fixed
	
	'''
	self.custom.filters = filters.messageHandler_UpdateFilter(payload, self.custom.filters)
	'''

# implement your handler here
	import traceback    
	try:        
		#Send the dataset to Excel        
		filename = 'winterShelter_congregationsTable_' + str(system.date.format(system.date.now(),"yyyyMMddHHmmss")) + '.xls'        
		dataset = self.props.data  
		columns = ["locationName","lastActiveSeason","city","zipCode","genderAccepted","beds","projection","actual","lastYear"]
		filtered_dataset = system.dataset.filterColumns(dataset,columns)  
		#Add header to dataset
		headers = ["Congregation","Last Active","City","Zip","Genders Accepted","Guests","This Season Projection","This Season Actual","Last Season Actual"]
		# convert filtered_dataset to py_dataset
		rows = []
		for i in range(filtered_dataset.getRowCount()):
			oneRow = [filtered_dataset.getValueAt(i,'locationName'),filtered_dataset.getValueAt(i,'lastActiveSeason'),filtered_dataset.getValueAt(i,'city'),filtered_dataset.getValueAt(i,'zipCode'),filtered_dataset.getValueAt(i,'genderAccepted'),filtered_dataset.getValueAt(i,'beds'),filtered_dataset.getValueAt(i,'projection'),filtered_dataset.getValueAt(i,'actual'),filtered_dataset.getValueAt(i,'lastYear')]
			rows.append(oneRow)
		# convert py_dataset to dataset and give header to it
		final_dataset = system.dataset.toDataSet(headers,rows)
		xlFile = system.dataset.toExcel(True,final_dataset)        
		system.perspective.download(filename, xlFile)    
	except:           
		logger = system.util.getLogger("Participants Dashboard tableToExcel")        
		msg = traceback.format_exc()        
		logger.error(msg)
